newsitem.title: PERU: "Anaconda" film horror a reality in Peru.
newsitem.headline: "Anaconda" film horror a reality in Peru.

text.p: A giant snake of the same species as the star of the box office hit "Anaconda" lived up to its on-screen reputation by killing three children in a remote Peruvian jungle region, a paper reported on Saturday.

The 18-foot (six-metre) long serpent surprised the children aged seven, 11 and 13, as they were fishing on the Ucayali river in Peru's Amazon jungle about 500 miles (800 km) northeast of Lima, witnesses told the Expreso newspaper.
The anaconda toppled the boat from which the youngsters were fishing and crushed them, they said.
Luis Llosa, director of the Hollywood film about a 40-foot-long snake on the loose in the Amazon, is Peruvian.
